intro: Hieracium prediliense, commonly known as the Predil hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium prediliense is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing alpine soils and supporting local biodiversity.
